summary: John Stein is a person who was interviewed at CIA Headquarters on March 18, 1975, by James B. Weidner regarding alleged domestic activities of the CIA, specifically focusing on the counter-intelligence (CI) staff's role and files on Americans. He is mentioned in an inventory of Rockefeller Commission files from June 1975, which details the contents and file codes of documents related to the CIA's activities, the Kennedy assassination, and other sensitive matters. The third document is about Thomas L. Briggs' potential appearance as a witness in the case of USA v. Gerald P. Hemming, detailing his interactions with the DEA, the Office of the General Counsel, and the Office of Security regarding his status as a CIA employee and how to handle questions about his employment.
